ValueDomain.preferredName: Pharmacokinetic Concentration Test Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A character or string that represents a pharmacokinetic concentration examination._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A character or string that represents a pharmacokinetic concentration examination.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/24/20 tmt released/Theradex reuse. 2/12/20 Created to support sponsor defined codelists; tmt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the name of the measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PCTEST; PCTESTCD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable. The SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PCTEST. The SDTMIG variables PCTESTCD and PCTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsors would typically collect tests related to the specimen characteristics on the CRF (e.g., Volume, Ph). Results for tests on an analyte (e.g., Concentration) would typically be populated when the SDTM-based datasets are created. If the analyte test results are collected on the CRF, the test would be the analyte name. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Test can be included as the column header.
